result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Lee Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency (Felony) [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 5+ Yrs)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).
  • Manufacture/Deliver Schedule IV Drugs [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Solicitation of], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(i).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees and surcharges by 11-25-2024 or if not paid, civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 233 days time served.

Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 11-25-2024; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to be provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge, to be collected from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 11-25-2024; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence with credit for zero days.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon, he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include taking any prescribed medications.

supervisions.notes:
COMMENCING AT THE CONCLUSION OF COUNT TWO.
Referral to the Mental Health UNit for Probation.
Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for ZERO time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.

miscConds.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges by 11-25-2024 or if not paid, civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded as to COUNT THREE: 

Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for ZERO  time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date. 

Court placed defendant on probation for THREE YEARS, COMMENCING AT THE CONCLUSION OF COUNT TWO  with the following conditions:
*referral to the Mental Health Unit of Probation
*take all prescribed medications 

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory  court costs, fees  and surcharges by 11-25-2024  or, if not paid, civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Sentencing proceeded AS TO COUNT TWO:  

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for EIGHT YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of FIVE  YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of THREE YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for ZERO days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 11-25-2024; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 11-25-2024 ; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include taking any prescribed medications

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Joseph Lee Walker in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Defendant Joseph Lee Walker in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Jury panel back to deliberate at the hour of 9:00am.    At the hour of 10:45 am the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY AS TO ALL THREE COUNTS  which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict WITH THE PENALTY ENHANCER  and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

Defendant Joseph Lee Walker in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Defendant Joseph Lee Walker in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Scott Schmitz-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Joseph Lee Walker in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Joseph Lee Walker in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
